skill.name: pydicom
skill.description: Python library for working with DICOM (Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine) files. Use this skill when reading, writing, or modifying medical imaging data in DICOM format, extracting pixel data from medical images (CT, MRI, X-ray, ultrasound), anonymizing DICOM files, working with DICOM metadata and tags, converting DICOM images to other formats, handling compressed DICOM data, or processing medical imaging datasets. Applies to tasks involving medical image analysis, PACS systems, radiology workflows, and healthcare imaging applications.

security_audit.summary: No data theft, exfiltration, or malicious execution patterns were found. Scripts focus on local DICOM processing and file output only.

content.user_title: Process DICOM files with pydicom workflows
content.value_statement: Medical imaging data is complex and hard to inspect safely. This skill provides clear steps and scripts for DICOM metadata, anonymization, and image conversion.
actual_capabilities: Anonymize DICOM PHI tags and save a new file
Convert DICOM pixel data to PNG, JPEG, TIFF, or BMP
Extract DICOM metadata to text or JSON
Apply VOI LUT windowing and handle multi-frame images
Convert YBR color space images to RGB when needed
limitations: Requires pydicom, numpy, and pillow to run scripts
Does not anonymize UIDs unless the user enables it
Metadata export skips sequences unless explicitly requested
Compressed DICOM may need extra codec packages

use_cases.title: Anonymize study datasets
use_cases.description: Remove PHI fields and create shareable DICOM files for analysis.

use_cases.title: Convert DICOM to images
use_cases.description: Export pixel data to PNG or JPEG for QA dashboards.

use_cases.title: Audit metadata fields
use_cases.description: Inspect patient and study tags before data sharing.

prompt_templates.title: Extract metadata
prompt_templates.scenario: Need a quick metadata report for a DICOM file
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract metadata from my DICOM file and save it as text using the provided script. Use the default output format.

prompt_templates.title: Anonymize a study
prompt_templates.scenario: Prepare a DICOM file for external sharing
prompt_templates.prompt: Anonymize this DICOM file and replace PatientName and PatientID with ANONYMOUS. Use the included anonymize script.

prompt_templates.title: Convert with windowing
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate a viewable PNG from a CT scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert a DICOM file to PNG and apply VOI LUT windowing. Use the conversion script and report the image info.

prompt_templates.title: Handle multi-frame
prompt_templates.scenario: Export a specific frame from a multi-frame DICOM
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert frame 5 from a multi-frame DICOM to JPEG. Use the conversion script and ensure frame selection is correct.

output_examples.input: Anonymize this DICOM and show what you changed.

best_practices: Verify anonymization results before sharing files
Check transfer syntax and install needed codecs
Use windowing for accurate image visualization
anti_patterns: Sharing DICOM files without verifying PHI removal
Assuming all compressed images will decode without extra libraries

faq.question: Is this compatible with all DICOM files?
faq.answer: It supports standard DICOM, but some compressed formats need extra codecs.

faq.question: What are the main limits of the scripts?
faq.answer: They do not validate DICOM conformance and UIDs are not anonymized by default.

faq.question: Can I integrate this in a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the scripts are CLI based and can be called from automation workflows.

faq.question: How is data safety handled?
faq.answer: Processing is local only and anonymization removes common PHI tags.

faq.question: What should I do if conversion fails?
faq.answer: Install missing codecs and verify the transfer syntax before retrying.

faq.question: How does this compare to other DICOM tools?
faq.answer: It provides lightweight Python scripts focused on metadata, anonymization, and image export.
